section.p: The following sections describe the prerequisites that must be fulfilled and the preparations you need to take before installing .

section.title: Hardware and Operating Systems
section.p: can be installed on a host machine with the following operating systems:
section.note: Make sure that you use a clean operating system. This avoids compatibility-related issues during the installation of .
section.p: As underlying platform technology, the following OpenStack platforms are supported:

ul.li: Red Hat Enterprise Linux OpenStack Platform 10

section.p: The following hardware resources are recommended:

p.i: NOTE TO REVIEWERS: These are the HW recommendation from 1.1. See also the HW recommendation for CMM 1.3 used in the SOCM documentation.

entry.p: Intel® Xeon® E5-2660 v2, 2.20 GHz or more

section.p: without any data requires about 2 GB of disk space. The disk capacity required for log data and metrics data varies considerably depending on the number of services and servers to be monitored.
Make sure that enough disk space is provided. If required, mount partitions for storing the log data and the metrics data. The default installation uses the following directories:

ul.li: The data directory of Elasticsearch is located in /var/data/elasticsearch.
The data directory of InfluxDB is located in /var/opt/influxdb/data.
The data directory of MariaDB is located in /var/lib/mysql.
The data directory of Kafka is located in /var/kafka.

p.i: NOTE TO REVIEWERS: These are the HW recommendation from 1.3 used in the SOCM documentation.

section.p: Architecture: x86_64
RAM: At least 32 GB, 64 GB or more recommended.
CPU: At least 8 cores, 16 cores or more recommended.
Hard Disk: SSD strongly recommended.
Disk Space: See below.
Formula for calculating the required disk space:
200 GB + [ number of nodes * retention period * (space for log data/day + space for metrics data/day) ] where

li.p: Retention period = 60 days for InfluxDB and Elasticsearch

section.p: This is only a basic rule of thumb. Depending on the OpenStack nodes to be monitored there might be additional factors that have an impact on the required disk space, for example, enabling debug logging for one or more OpenStack services.

section.title: Security
section.p: In a default Red Hat Enterprise Linux installation, the following security precautions are taken:

ul.li: A firewall exists to prevent unauthorized user access.
Security-Enhanced Linux (SELinux), a security module that adds mandatory access control mechanisms to the Linux kernel, is enabled.

section.p: Before installing the components, make sure that the firewall is enabled and SELinux is running. Make sure that neither the firewall nor SELinux block the communication between the Control Machine and the remote machines.
The installation of the components opens the following ports:
Port 8081 is required internally by the Monitoring API, for example, for healthchecks or threads. ##To be changed?##
uses the following ports to integrate with the required OpenStack services:

ul.li: Port 80 for the OpenStack Horizon service.
Port 5000 and 35357 for the OpenStack Keystone service.

section.p: If it is necessary to manually enable access to the ports, you can execute the following commands. Repeat them for each port to which access must be enabled.
section.codeblock:
firewall-cmd --add-port=<port_number>/tcp firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=<port_number>/tcp firewall-cmd --reload
firewall-cmd --add-port=<port_number>/udp firewall-cmd --permanent --add-port=<port_number>/udp firewall-cmd --reload
section.p: Replace <port_number> with the port.
